FirstSection.title: Business Analytics Course Mumbai

BoxShape.title: Why Join this Programme?
BoxShape.box1desc: Bring your own projects and receive the assistance you need to complete them. Besides, get project certification from well-known startups.
BoxShape.box2desc: Most importantly, you will be able to design your own course to meet your individual learning requirements and goals.
BoxShape.box3desc: Firstly, you will get free career counselling and help to get started. Secondly, we assist you with interview preparation and generate job prospects.
BoxShape.box4desc: Above all, with a three-year membership, you will have access to the business analytics course for three years.

Certificate.altR: Get Real Work Experience Certificate by taking Business analytics course in Mumbai online

GetHired.heading: Work on live projects to get hired at:

RealWork.desc: Basically, most courses only teach students the fundamentals. However, under Skillslash’s business analytics course in Mumbai, we focus on the actual work experience. Because, work experience can be useful in several ways. Some of which are given below:

syllabusDesc: SOur business analytics course is curated by leading faculties and industry leaders. Especially, with the aim to provide practical learning experience with live interactive classes and projects.

chap.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Programming ( 3 hrs )
desc: Source code Vs bytecode Vs machine code, Compiler Vs Interpreter, C/C++, Java Vs Python.

chap.title: Chapter 2: code editors basics (1 hrs)
desc: Different type of code editors in python, Introduction to Anaconda and IDEs

chap.title: Chapter 3: python basics (1 hrs)
desc: Variable Vs Identifiers, Strings Operators Vs Operand, Procedure oriented Vs Modular programming.

chap.title: Chapter 4: statistics basics & probability (1 hrs)
desc: Measures of Central Tendency & dispersion, Inferential statistics and Sampling theory.

chap.title: Chapter 2: PYTHON INTRODUCTION (1 hrs)
desc: How a Python Program runs on our system?
Features of Python Memory Management in Python,

chap.title: Chapter 6: EXPECTION HANDELING
desc: Nestedtry-except block & Default except for block.

chap.title: Chapter 7: MODULES IN PYTHON
desc: Importing Modules and different import statement

chap.title: Chapter 8: FILE HANDELING
desc: Why do we need File Handling?

chap.title: Chapter 10: NUMPY IN PYTHON
desc: Intro & use of numpy, What is an array?

chap.title: Chapter 11: PANDAS IN PYTHON
desc: Exporting Dataframe to CSV and Excel

chap.title: Chapter 13: Seaborn
desc: Working with seaborn on titanic dataset

chap.title: Chapter 1:- Probability and Statistical Inferences ( 4 hrs )
desc: Discrete Probability Distributions - Binomial, Poisson etc
Continuous Probability Distributions - Gaussian, Normal, etc

chap.title: Chapter 2: Statistics Foundations (1 hrs)
desc: Measures of Central tendency and Dispersion
Sampling theory and scales of measurement

chap.title: Chapter 3: Hypothesis Testing and its Applications (1 hrs)
desc: Basic Concepts - Formulation of Hypothesis, Making a decision
Advanced Concepts - Choice of Test - t test vs z test
Evaluation of Test - P value and Critical Value approach

chap.title: Chapter 1:Primer on Machine Learning ( 3 hrs )
desc: Types of Analysis - Descriptive, Predictive, and Prescriptive
Bias Variance Tradeoff - Overfitting vs Underfitting

chap.title: Chapter 2: Regression
desc: What is linear in Linear Regression?
Model Evaluation Metrics for regression problems - MAE, RMSE, MSE, and MAP

chap.title: Chapter 3: Classification
desc: Up sampling, Down sampling and SMOTE

chap.title: Chapter 4: Clustering-K means
desc: K Means Algorithms - Partition based model for clustering

chap.title: Chapter 5: KNN
desc: Non-Parametric algorithms and Lazy learning ideology
Applications in Missing value imputes and Balancing datasets

chap.title: Chapter 7: Decision Trees
desc: Why are they called Greedy Algorithms?
Susceptibility to overfitting and high variance

chap.title: Chapter 8: Ensemble Techniques
desc: Introduction to Bagging as an Ensemble technique
Bootstrap Aggregation and Out of Bag error
Random Forests and its Applications in Feature selection
How Bagging overcomes the overfitting problem?
How Boosting overcomes the Bias - Variance Tradeoff
Gradient Boosting and Xgboost as regularised boosting

chap.title: Chapter 9: Support Vector Machines
desc: Linear, Polynomia, and RBF kernels, SVMs for regression and classification

chap.title: Chapter 10: Bayesian Family Algorithms
desc: Bag of words and TF-IDF algorithm
Multinomial and Gaussian Naive Bayes, Bayesian Belief networks and Path models.

chap.title: Chapter 11: Time-series Analysis
desc: The Random Walk model and Stationarity of Time Series
Tests for Stationarity - ADF and Dickey- Fuller test, AR, MA, ARIMA, SARIMA models
A regression approach to time series forecasting.

chap.title: Chapter 12: Machine Learning Pipeline & auto ML
desc: Serving the model via Rest API & Keras.

chap.title: Chapter 1:- Introduction to SQL
desc: Working with MySQL, DDL, TCL, DML commands
Database manipu lation, management, and administration

chap.title: Chapter 2: No SQL Databases
desc: Advantages of MongoDB over RDBMS Use cases.

chap.title: Chapter 6: JOINS & string function
desc: Usage of different types of JOINS
Usage of string functions like; CONCAT, SUBSTRING etc
INNER join,OUTER join, Full join, Left Join, Right Join, UNION.

chap.title: Chapter 8: SQL Statements & functions
desc: WHERE vs HAVING, UPDATE, DELETE, AS
Count function, MIN and MAX, Sum Function, Avg Function

chap.title: Chapter 1: Mongo DB
desc: What are Object Ids in MongoDb.

chap.title: Chapter 1: Excel Fundamentals
desc: Excel Toolbars: Hiding, Displaying, and Moving Toolbars.
Switching Between Sheets in a Workbook.
Hiding and Unhiding Columns, Rows and Sheets.
Opening, saving and closing Excel document.

chap.title: Chapter 2: Worksheet Customization
desc: Creating Headers, Footers, and Page Numbers.
Adjusting Row Height and Column Width.
Moving and Copying Data in an Excel Worksheet.
Inserting and Deleting Rows and Columns.

chap.title: Chapter 3: Images and Shapes into Excel Worksheet
Chapter 4: Basic work on Excel
desc: Entering and selecting values. Using numeric data in excel
Working with forms menu, cell references, conditional
Finding and replacing information from worksheet
Inserting & deleting cells, rows and columns.

chap.title: Chapter 5: Excel Formulae
desc: Im plementing excel formulae in worksheet
Relative vs Absol ute cell references in formulae
Entering and Editing text, Fixing errors in your formulae
Formulae with several operators, Formulae with cell ranges

chap.title: Chapter 6: Excel Functions
desc: Working with functions like SUM(), AVERAGE() etc
Adjacent cells error in excel calculations

chap.title: Chapter 7: Charts and Graphs
desc: Working with the excel chart ribbon.
Adding and modifying data on an Excel chart.
Moving a chart to another worksheet.
Adding titles, gridlines and a data table.
Formatting a data series and chart axis.
Changing a chart type and working with pie charts.

chap.title: Chapter 8: Support Vector Machines
desc: Structuring Source Data for Analysis in Excel
Exploring Pivot Ta ble Analyse & Desig n Options
Working with and on pivot tables
Enriching data with Pivot table calculated values & fields

chap.title: Chapter 9: Basic Macros
desc: Assigning a Macro a Shortcut Key.

chap.title: Chapter 2: Data Types in TABLEAU
desc: Adding a second layer moving average

chap.title: Chapter 1: Introducation To Power BI
desc: Understanding the Power BI Desktop Workflow.
Exploring the Interface of the Data Model.

chap.title: Chapter 2: Query Editor
desc: Connecting Power BI Desktop to Source Files.

chap.title: Chapter 3: Power BI
desc: Working with Time series Understanding aggregation and granularity
Filters and Slicers in Power BI

chap.title: Chapter 4: Data Models
desc: SUM, AVERAGE, MIN, MAX, SUMX, COUNT, DIVIDE, COUNT, COUNTROOMS, CALCULATE, FILTER, ALL

chap.title: Chapter 5: Time Intelligence
desc: Create data table in M and DAX, Display last refresh Date.

Review.title: Why pratical learning experience is vital?
Review.desc: Skillslash’s online business analytics certification in Mumbai is designed for creative minds and made for everyone. Take business analytics course with us. And, experience the new era of education.

Fee.desc: The business analytics course fee starts from ₹ 60,000 (Excluding GST). Besides, we aim to deliver to you quality education considering the aspect of feasibility
Fee.desc1: We are driven by the idea of program affordability. So, we give you several financial options to manage and budget the course expenses. Because we believe in fair reachability and access to all our carefully curated programs. Therefore, you get options such as EMI to pay the business analytics course fees.

FAQ.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.desc: Have a look at the FAQ’s below to know more about our business analytics training, fees and project details.

FaqDATA.ques: What is the business analytics course duration in Mumbai and what modules are covered?
FaqDATA.ans: The duration of the business analytics course in Mumbai is 5 months. But, depending on your schedule (weekdays/weekends), the amount of time you spend learning will vary. Under our business analytics training, in different modules you will be able to study about a variety of topics. Beginning with the fundamentals of programming, such as python and cloud basics, and progressing to advanced Excel, DBMS - SQL and NoSQL, and data visualization using power BI and Tableau.

FaqDATA.ques: What are the requirements to take a business analytics certification course in Mumbai?
FaqDATA.ans: Every enthusiastic data science aspirant, we believe, is capable of making a successful data science career move. But, no, we don't have any stringent eligibility requirements. However, we do assess candidates' aptitude for the learning module in the business analytics sector. Specifically, on the basis of programming skills and statistical knowledge. The business analytics course is specifically curated for professionals. Also, a candidate must have at least one year of professional experience in any field.

FaqDATA.ques: What is the business analytics course fee at Skillslash?
FaqDATA.ans: The business analytics training has a course fee start from INR 60,000. In addition, you can also avail a scholarship program under our business analytics course in Mumbai. Besides, you can get up to a 10% scholarship for the business analytics training in Mumbai if you take an aptitude exam. So, if a candidate has a score of more than 65 percent on the aptitude exam, he or she will be eligible for a 10 percent reduction on the course fees.

FaqDATA.ques: If I have to miss a class due to an emergency, will there be a make-up class available?
FaqDATA.ans: Firstly, we provide live online classes. Additionally, all of our students have access to video recordings of those classes. Besides, we provide you with unrestricted access to these recorded sessions. So, you can refer to them whenever you need theoretical assistance in your business analytics, AI or ML career. As a result, if you miss any of the live classes, you need not be disappointed. That said, we do, however, strongly encourage you to attend all live classes.

FaqDATA.ques: How many projects are included in this business analytics course in Mumbai?
FaqDATA.ans: The business analytics certification in Mumbai offers 15+ real-world projects from which you can choose a couple for case study learning based on the demands of your domain. Aside from that, under the business analytics course curriculum, you will have the opportunity to work on three industry projects (capstone projects) with a variety of MNCs and startups.

FaqDATA.ques: What kind of certification does the business analytics course provide?
FaqDATA.ans: The catch is that you will not receive any form of certification or academic degree if you attend the business analytics training. Instead, we provide a project management certificate that is recognized all over the world. Besides, under this business analytics course in Mumbai, you can get direct certifications from the company with which you completed your industrial project.
